abstract: Ekblad's creations - crude and polished, blithe and bold - offer perspectives on modern art and culture, with and without a capital M.
snippet: Ekblad's creations - crude and polished, blithe and bold - offer perspectives on modern art and culture, with and without a capital M.
lead_paragraph: Ida Ekblad is at once a sculptor, painter, video maker and poet. Her motley creations - crude and polished, blithe and bold - offer perspectives on modern art and culture, with and without a capital M. Her sculpture reaches back to beatific tropes of postwar art history, which she solders together with the harsh trash of today's world: industrial materials (scrap metal is a favorite) collected from streets and junkyards. Her paintings marry similar sentiments, committing the intangible debris of brutish shapes and colors to canvas.
